p: The EO yields of H. officinalis in this study were much higher than the ones reported in the literature. As mentioned, factors may influence the EO yield of H. officinalis, such as harvest time and drying [ 35], planting densities [ 36], year of the extraction [ 37], plant parts [ 38], and the type of distillation. It is well known that hydrodistillation is more efficient than steam distillation. The results from this study support the concept of reducing energy consumption by controlling the DT.
